void tbb::internal::concurrent_monitor::cancel_wait ( thread_context &  thr)

Cancel the wait. Removes the thread from the wait queue if not removed yet.

References tbb::internal::concurrent_monitor::thread_context::in_waitset, mutex_ec, tbb::internal::circular_doubly_linked_list_with_sentinel::remove(), tbb::internal::concurrent_monitor::thread_context::skipped_wakeup, and waitset_ec.

54  {
55  // possible skipped wakeup will be pumped in the following prepare_wait()
56  thr.skipped_wakeup = true;
57  // try to remove node from waitset
58  bool th_in_waitset = thr.in_waitset;
59  if( th_in_waitset ) {
60  tbb::spin_mutex::scoped_lock l( mutex_ec );
61  if (thr.in_waitset) {
62  waitset_ec.remove( (waitset_t::node_t&)thr );
63  // node is removed from waitset, so there will be no wakeup
64  thr.in_waitset = false;
65  thr.skipped_wakeup = false;
66  }
67  }
68 }

bool tbb::internal::concurrent_monitor::commit_wait ( thread_context &  thr)
inline

Commit wait if event count has not changed; otherwise, cancel wait.

Returns true if committed, false if canceled.
